author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Unidentified persons on Thursday night vandalised the portrait of Jawaharlal Nehru University Students’ Union (JNUSU) president Kanhaiya Kumar sketched two days ago on the walls of his mud-and-tile house in his village by art students from Shantiniketan and Patna.

“Some hoodlums have defaced the portrait of Kanhaiya sketched and painted by some artists from Shantiniketan and Patna on Thursday night. It is quite disturbing that such elements have reached even the village home of Kanhaiya”, Pushp Raj, a social and political activist told The Hindu .

Mr. Raj had visited Kanhaiya’s village Masnadpur on Wednesday along with the artists and explained their art to the locals there.
title: Student leader’s portrait at village vandalised
